result.execSummary:
The defendant Deangelo Lamont Bates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay victim witness surcharges and all costs, assessments and surcharges, DNA surcharge.  Failure to pay will result in entry of a civil judgment.
Maintain employment.  Obtain GED or HSED.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already provided.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
No further violations of the law.

Follow all rules of probation.
Other counseling needs to be determined.
AODA assessment and any treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deangelo Lamont Bates

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deangelo Lamont Bates in court with attorney John C. Glover.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 17.
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction, consecutive to any sentence; credit for 5 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-Follow all rules of probation.
-No further violations of the law.
-AODA assessment and any treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Random urine screens.
-Maintain employment.
-Obtain GED or HSED.
-Other counseling needs to be determined.
-Perform 40 HOURS of community service at a non-profit agency.
-Pay victim witness surcharge and all costs, assessments and surcharges.
Failure to pay will result in entry of civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already provided, and pay the DNA fees and surcharges, if not to be docketed as a civil judgment.
.
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated October 1, 2014, received and filed.

Defendant Deangelo Lamont Bates in court with attorney John C. Glover.  Paul Hauer for Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Final Pretrial. Defense proceeds to Plea Hearing.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information. Judgment of conviction entered.  
 Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court vacates the Jury Trial scheduled for 9-10-2014. 
Case adjourned for Sentencing on 10-2-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated September 2, 2014, received and filed.

Defendant Deangelo Lamont Bates in court with attorney John C. Glover.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17 in room 313 of the safety building.  Jury trial scheduled for 09-10-2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Deangelo Lamont Bates in court with attorney John C. Glover.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-18-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deangelo Lamont Bates in court with attorney John C Glover.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Chojnacki).
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Case set for plea/sentencing on 7-14-14, 1:30.

Defendant Deangelo Lamont Bates in court.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter before court for plea hearing, however attorney Glover is unable to appear due to illness.  Court ordered case adjourned for plea hearing in Branch 26.  Deputy provided court slip to defendant with next court date.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Deangelo Lamont Bates in court with attorney John C Glover.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has another matter before drug treatment court; this  case being considered also.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deangelo Lamont Bates in court with attorney John C Glover.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/2/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Deangelo Lamont Bates in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Deangelo Lamont Bates in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
